      <h3 style="font-size: 18px; color: #E2E8F0; margin: 0 0 16px 0;">What is Microsoft 365 Copilot?</h3>
      <p style="color: #94A3B8; line-height: 1.7; margin: 0 0 16px 0;">Microsoft 365 Copilot is an AI assistant built into the Office apps you already use: Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Teams. It uses large language models combined with your organisation's data to help you work faster.</p>

      <div style="background: #3D2E0A; border: 1px solid #F59E0B; border-radius: 12px; padding: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px;">
        <div style="display: flex; align-items: flex-start; gap: 12px;">
          <span style="font-size: 24px;">üîí</span>
          <div>
            <strong style="color: #FBBF24;">Enterprise vs Consumer: Your data stays private</strong>
            <p style="margin: 8px 0 0 0; color: #FCD34D; line-height: 1.6;">Curtin's enterprise Copilot is different from the consumer version. Your data is siloed per user: email queries only see your mailbox, not anyone else's. Copilot can access your SharePoint, shared drives, and personal OneDrive, but only content you already have permission to view. Nothing is used to train the model.</p>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>

      <div style="background: #0D2818; border: 1px solid #1A4731; border-radius: 12px; padding: 20px; margin-bottom: 20px;">

        <p style="margin: 8px 0 0 0; color: #4ADE80; line-height: 1.6;">Copilot can do things <em>for</em> you, but it is most valuable when it helps you think <em>better</em>. Throughout this experience, we will show you both approaches ‚Äî quick delegation for routine tasks, and conversation for the work that matters. The goal is conversation, not delegation.</p>

      <p style="color: #94A3B8; line-height: 1.7; margin: 0 0 12px 0;">This experience has <strong style="color: #E2E8F0;">6 steps</strong>. Each step focuses on a different Microsoft 365 app. Work through at your own pace, and try the prompts with your own data as you go.</p>

      <h2 style="font-size: 22px; color: #E2E8F0; margin: 0 0 16px 0;">Copilot in Outlook</h2>
      <p style="color: #94A3B8; line-height: 1.7; margin: 0 0 20px 0;">Copilot in Outlook can draft replies, summarise long email threads, and help you catch up after time away. It works with your mailbox only, so it sees the same emails you do.</p>

      <div style="background: #16162A; border: 1px solid #2D2D4A; border-radius: 12px; padding: 24px; margin-bottom: 16px;">
        <h3 style="font-size: 16px; color: #E2E8F0; margin: 0 0 16px 0;">What Copilot can do in Outlook</h3>
        <div style="display: flex; flex-direction: column; gap: 12px;">
          <div style="background: #1E1E36; padding: 16px; border-radius: 8px;">
            <strong style="color: #C7D2FE;">Summarise threads</strong>
            <p style="margin: 8px 0 0 0; color: #94A3B8; font-size: 14px;">Open a long email chain and click "Summary by Copilot" to get a concise overview of key points, decisions, and action items.</p>
          </div>
          <div style="background: #1E1E36; padding: 16px; border-radius: 8px;">
            <strong style="color: #C7D2FE;">Draft replies</strong>
            <p style="margin: 8px 0 0 0; color: #94A3B8; font-size: 14px;">When composing a reply, Copilot can generate a draft based on the thread context. You review, edit, and send.</p>
          </div>
          <div style="background: #1E1E36; padding: 16px; border-radius: 8px;">
            <strong style="color: #C7D2FE;">Catch up on missed conversations</strong>
            <p style="margin: 8px 0 0 0; color: #94A3B8; font-size: 14px;">After leave or a busy period, ask Copilot to summarise what you missed. It will pull highlights from your unread messages.</p>
          </div>
          <div style="background: #1E1E36; padding: 16px; border-radius: 8px;">
            <strong style="color: #C7D2FE;">Schedule and organise</strong>
            <p style="margin: 8px 0 0 0; color: #94A3B8; font-size: 14px;">Ask Copilot to find a time for a meeting, draft a calendar invite, or suggest follow-up actions from an email thread.</p>

        <p style="margin: 0 0 8px 0; color: #94A3B8; font-size: 14px;">Open a long email thread in Outlook, click the Copilot icon, and try:</p>

        <p style="margin: 0 0 8px 0; color: #94A3B8; font-size: 14px;">Or when drafting a reply:</p>
        <div style="background: #16162A; padding: 12px 16px; border-radius: 8px; font-family: 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 14px; color: #E2E8F0; margin-bottom: 12px;">"Draft a professional reply confirming I can attend the meeting and asking for the agenda to be shared beforehand."</div>
        <p style="margin: 0 0 8px 0; color: #94A3B8; font-size: 14px;">After returning from leave:</p>
        <div style="background: #16162A; padding: 12px 16px; border-radius: 8px; font-family: 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 14px; color: #E2E8F0;">"What are the key emails I need to respond to from last week? Summarise anything urgent."</div>
      </div>

        <div style="display: flex; align-items: flex-start; gap: 12px;">
          <span style="font-size: 24px;">‚ö†Ô∏è</span>

            <ul style="margin: 8px 0 0 0; padding-left: 20px; color: #FCD34D; line-height: 1.8;">
              <li>Always read Copilot's draft before sending. It may misinterpret tone or miss nuance.</li>
              <li>Summaries can miss context that was communicated verbally or in separate channels.</li>
              <li>Copilot cannot access emails outside your mailbox, so it may not have the full picture.</li>
            </ul>

      <h2 style="font-size: 22px; color: #E2E8F0; margin: 0 0 16px 0;">Copilot in Word</h2>
      <p style="color: #94A3B8; line-height: 1.7; margin: 0 0 20px 0;">Copilot in Word helps you draft documents from scratch, summarise existing ones, rewrite sections for a different audience, and pull content from files on SharePoint or OneDrive.</p>

      <div style="background: #16162A; border: 1px solid #2D2D4A; border-radius: 12px; padding: 24px; margin-bottom: 16px;">
        <h3 style="font-size: 16px; color: #E2E8F0; margin: 0 0 16px 0;">What Copilot can do in Word</h3>
        <div style="display: flex; flex-direction: column; gap: 12px;">
          <div style="background: #1E1E36; padding: 16px; border-radius: 8px;">
            <strong style="color: #C7D2FE;">Draft from notes or briefs</strong>
            <p style="margin: 8px 0 0 0; color: #94A3B8; font-size: 14px;">Give Copilot dot points, meeting notes, or a rough outline and ask it to produce a structured draft. Great for committee papers, reports, or proposals.</p>
          </div>
          <div style="background: #1E1E36; padding: 16px; border-radius: 8px;">
            <strong style="color: #C7D2FE;">Summarise long documents</strong>
            <p style="margin: 8px 0 0 0; color: #94A3B8; font-size: 14px;">Open a lengthy policy document or report and ask Copilot to summarise key points. Useful for preparing briefs or catching up on reading.</p>
          </div>
          <div style="background: #1E1E36; padding: 16px; border-radius: 8px;">
            <strong style="color: #C7D2FE;">Rewrite for tone or audience</strong>
            <p style="margin: 8px 0 0 0; color: #94A3B8; font-size: 14px;">Ask Copilot to rewrite a section to be more concise, more formal, or more accessible. Helpful when adapting content for different stakeholders.</p>
          </div>
          <div style="background: #1E1E36; padding: 16px; border-radius: 8px;">
            <strong style="color: #C7D2FE;">Reference SharePoint content</strong>
            <p style="margin: 8px 0 0 0; color: #94A3B8; font-size: 14px;">Use the "/" command to reference files stored on SharePoint or OneDrive. Copilot can incorporate content from those files into your current document.</p>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>

      <!-- Try This: Delegation -->
      <div style="background: #1E1B4B; border: 2px solid #4F46E5; border-radius: 12px; padding: 20px; margin-bottom: 16px;">
        <h3 style="font-size: 14px; color: #A5B4FC; margin: 0 0 12px 0; font-family: 'Courier New', monospace; text-transform: uppercase; letter-spacing: 1px;">Try this: Delegation (fine for routine tasks)</h3>
        <p style="margin: 0 0 8px 0; color: #94A3B8; font-size: 14px;">Open a new Word document, click the Copilot icon, and try:</p>
        <div style="background: #16162A; padding: 12px 16px; border-radius: 8px; font-family: 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 14px; color: #E2E8F0; margin-bottom: 12px;">"Draft a one-page committee brief summarising the key points from /[SharePoint file name]. Include a recommendation section at the end."</div>
        <p style="margin: 0; color: #94A3B8; font-size: 13px;">This is delegation ‚Äî Copilot does the work, you review. Perfectly fine for routine summaries and first drafts.</p>
      </div>

      <!-- Try This: Conversation -->
      <div style="background: #0D2818; border: 2px solid #22C55E; border-radius: 12px; padding: 20px; margin-bottom: 16px;">
        <h3 style="font-size: 14px; color: #86EFAC; margin: 0 0 12px 0; font-family: 'Courier New', monospace; text-transform: uppercase; letter-spacing: 1px;">Now try this: Conversation (for work that matters)</h3>
        <p style="margin: 0 0 8px 0; color: #94A3B8; font-size: 14px;">When the document needs your thinking ‚Äî a proposal, a recommendation, a case for change ‚Äî try a different approach:</p>
        <div style="background: #16162A; padding: 12px 16px; border-radius: 8px; font-family: 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 13px; color: #E2E8F0; margin-bottom: 12px;">"I'm writing a brief recommending we [your proposal]. Before I draft it, what are the three strongest objections a sceptical reader might raise? And what evidence would I need to address each one?"</div>
        <p style="margin: 0 0 12px 0; color: #94A3B8; font-size: 14px;">Then follow up:</p>
        <div style="background: #16162A; padding: 12px 16px; border-radius: 8px; font-family: 'Courier New', monospace; font-size: 13px; color: #E2E8F0; margin-bottom: 12px;">"Good. Now help me structure the brief so the recommendation feels inevitable by the time the reader reaches it. What should come first ‚Äî the problem, the evidence, or the cost of inaction?"</div>
        <p style="margin: 0; color: #86EFAC; font-size: 13px;">Notice the difference: you are thinking <em>with</em> Copilot, not handing the task over. The document that results will be yours, shaped by your judgement, not a generic AI draft.</p>
      </div>

      <!-- What to Watch For -->
      <div style="background: #3D2E0A; border: 1px solid #F59E0B; border-radius: 12px; padding: 20px;">

            <ul style="margin: 8px 0 0 0; padding-left: 20px; color: #FCD34D; line-height: 1.8;">
              <li>Copilot may invent details that were not in your source material. Always verify facts and figures.</li>
              <li>Referenced files need to be on SharePoint or OneDrive (not your local desktop) for Copilot to access them.</li>
              <li>The output is a starting point. Your knowledge of the context, stakeholders, and politics is what makes it fit for purpose.</li>
            </ul>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>

      <h2 style="font-size: 22px; color: #E2E8F0; margin: 0 0 16px 0;">Copilot in Excel</h2>
      <p style="color: #94A3B8; line-height: 1.7; margin: 0 0 20px 0;">Copilot in Excel lets you ask questions about your data in plain English, generate formulas without memorising syntax, and create charts with a simple description of what you want to see.</p>

      <div style="background: #16162A; border: 1px solid #2D2D4A; border-radius: 12px; padding: 24px; margin-bottom: 16px;">
        <h3 style="font-size: 16px; color: #E2E8F0; margin: 0 0 16px 0;">What Copilot can do in Excel</h3>
        <div style="display: flex; flex-direction: column; gap: 12px;">
          <div style="background: #1E1E36; padding: 16px; border-radius: 8px;">
            <strong style="color: #C7D2FE;">Ask questions about your data</strong>
            <p style="margin: 8px 0 0 0; color: #94A3B8; font-size: 14px;">Type a question like "What was the total spend in Q3?" or "Which department had the highest enrolment?" Copilot analyses your spreadsheet and gives you the answer.</p>
          </div>

<script>
(function() {
  var experienceId = 'working-with-copilot';
  var TOTAL_STEPS = 6;
  var STORAGE_KEY = 'ai-passport-steps-working-with-copilot';
  var urlParams = new URLSearchParams(window.location.search);
  var uid = urlParams.get('uid') || 'anonymous';

  // Step names for progress bar
  var stepNames = ['', 'Welcome', 'Outlook', 'Word', 'Excel', 'PPT & Teams', 'Wrap Up'];

  // ---- Step state ----
  var currentStep = 1;
  var highestCompleted = 0;

  function loadStepProgress() {
    try {
      var saved = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem(STORAGE_KEY) || '{}');
      highestCompleted = saved.highestCompleted || 0;
      currentStep = saved.currentStep || 1;
      if (currentStep > highestCompleted + 1) currentStep = highestCompleted + 1;
    } catch (e) {
      highestCompleted = 0;
      currentStep = 1;
    }
  }

  function saveStepProgress() {
    localStorage.setItem(STORAGE_KEY, JSON.stringify({
      highestCompleted: highestCompleted,
      currentStep: currentStep
    }));
  }

  // ---- Progress bar rendering ----
  function renderProgressBar() {
    var bar = document.getElementById('progress-bar');
    var html = '';

    for (var i = 1; i <= TOTAL_STEPS; i++) {
      var isCompleted = i <= highestCompleted;
      var isCurrent = i === currentStep;
      var isLocked = i > highestCompleted + 1;

      // Connector line (before each step except the first)
      if (i > 1) {
        html += '<div style="flex: 1; max-width: 40px; height: 2px; background: ' +
          (i <= highestCompleted + 1 ? '#4F46E5' : '#2D2D4A') +
          '; align-self: center;"></div>';
      }

      // Step circle
      var bg, color, border, cursor, opacity;
      if (isCurrent) {
        bg = '#4F46E5'; color = 'white'; border = '2px solid #7C3AED'; cursor = 'default'; opacity = '1';
      } else if (isCompleted) {
        bg = '#0D2818'; color = '#22C55E'; border = '2px solid #22C55E'; cursor = 'pointer'; opacity = '1';
      } else {
        bg = '#1E1E36'; color = '#64748B'; border = '2px solid #2D2D4A'; cursor = 'default'; opacity = '0.5';
      }

      var clickHandler = isCompleted ? 'onclick="goToStep(' + i + ')"' : '';
      var title = isLocked ? 'Complete previous steps first' : stepNames[i];

      html += '<div ' + clickHandler + ' title="' + title + '" style="' +
        'width: 36px; height: 36px; border-radius: 50%; display: flex; align-items: center; justify-content: center; ' +
        'font-size: 13px; font-weight: bold; flex-shrink: 0; transition: all 0.2s; ' +
        'background: ' + bg + '; color: ' + color + '; border: ' + border + '; cursor: ' + cursor + '; opacity: ' + opacity + ';">' +
        (isCompleted && !isCurrent ? '&#10003;' : i) + '</div>';
    }

    bar.innerHTML = html;
  }

  // ---- Step navigation ----
  function showStep(step) {
    var allSteps = document.querySelectorAll('.exp-step');
    for (var s = 0; s < allSteps.length; s++) {
      allSteps[s].style.display = 'none';
    }

    var target = document.querySelector('.exp-step[data-step="' + step + '"]');
    if (target) {
      target.style.display = 'block';
    }

    currentStep = step;

    if (step - 1 > highestCompleted) {
      highestCompleted = step - 1;
    }

    saveStepProgress();
    renderProgressBar();

    document.getElementById('experience-app').scrollIntoView({ behavior: 'smooth', block: 'start' });
  }

  window.goToStep = function(step) {
    if (step >= 1 && step <= TOTAL_STEPS && step <= highestCompleted + 2) {
      showStep(step);
    }
  };

  // ---- Completion tracking ----
  var badges = {
    1: { emoji: 'üß™', name: 'Explorer' },
    3: { emoji: 'üß†', name: 'Thinker' },
    5: { emoji: 'üõ†Ô∏è', name: 'Builder' },
    7: { emoji: 'üèÜ', name: 'Champion' }
  };

  window.recordCompletion = function() {
    var btn = document.getElementById('complete-btn');
    btn.disabled = true;
    btn.textContent = 'Recording...';
    btn.style.background = '#94A3B8';

    highestCompleted = TOTAL_STEPS;
    saveStepProgress();
    renderProgressBar();

    saveToLocalStorage();
    showCompletionSuccess();
  };

  function saveToLocalStorage() {
    var completions = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('ai-passport-completions') || '{}');
    completions[experienceId] = {
      completedAt: new Date().toISOString(),
      uid: uid
    };
    localStorage.setItem('ai-passport-completions', JSON.stringify(completions));
  }

  function showCompletionSuccess() {
    document.getElementById('completion-trigger').style.display = 'none';
    document.getElementById('completion-section').style.display = 'block';

    var completions = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('ai-passport-completions') || '{}');
    var completedCount = Object.keys(completions).length;

    var badgeHtml = '';
    var nextBadge = null;

    for (var count in badges) {
      if (completedCount >= parseInt(count)) {
        badgeHtml += '<span style="font-size: 24px; margin: 0 4px;" title="' + badges[count].name + '">' + badges[count].emoji + '</span>';
      } else if (!nextBadge) {
        nextBadge = { count: parseInt(count), emoji: badges[count].emoji, name: badges[count].name };
      }
    }

    var progressText = '<div style="margin-bottom: 8px;">' + (badgeHtml || '<span style="color: #94A3B8;">Start your collection!</span>') + '</div>';
    progressText += '<p style="font-size: 13px; color: #64748B; margin: 0;">' + completedCount + ' experience' + (completedCount !== 1 ? 's' : '') + ' completed</p>';

    if (nextBadge) {
      progressText += '<p style="font-size: 12px; color: #94A3B8; margin: 4px 0 0 0;">Next badge: ' + nextBadge.emoji + ' ' + nextBadge.name + ' (' + (nextBadge.count - completedCount) + ' more)</p>';
    }

    document.getElementById('badge-progress').innerHTML = progressText;
  }

  function checkExistingCompletion() {
    var completions = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('ai-passport-completions') || '{}');
    if (completions[experienceId]) {
      document.getElementById('completion-trigger').innerHTML =
        '<div style="color: #22C55E; font-size: 24px; margin-bottom: 8px;">&#10003;</div>' +
        '<p style="font-size: 14px; color: #64748B; margin: 0;">You completed this experience on ' + new Date(completions[experienceId].completedAt).toLocaleDateString() + '</p>';
    }
  }

  // ---- Initialise ----
  loadStepProgress();
  renderProgressBar();
  showStep(currentStep);
  checkExistingCompletion();
})();
</script>
